meanings.definition: Suffering from or relating to consumption, especially pulmonary tuberculosis.
meanings.sent1: The consumptive patient coughed frequently in the hospital.
meanings.sent2: The doctor diagnosed the consumptive man with tuberculosis.
meanings.sent3: The consumptive character in the play always carried a handkerchief.
meanings.sent4: Her love for him was like a consumptive disease, slowly draining her emotions.
meanings.sent5: The consumptive sunset painted the sky in hues of pink and orange.

meanings.definition: Tending to consume or use up resources.
meanings.sent1: The consumptive habits of the company led to a depletion of natural resources.
meanings.sent2: The consumptive nature of the project required constant funding.
meanings.sent3: The consumptive printer devoured ink cartridges at an alarming rate.
meanings.sent4: Her shopping addiction was like a consumptive force, emptying her bank account.
meanings.sent5: The consumptive fire quickly spread through the dry forest, consuming everything in its path.
